briefdescription.para: implements the actual volatility calculation in derived classes

detaileddescription.para: For the curve strike is ignored because the smile is (can only be) flat.

memberdef.argsstring: (Natural settlementDays, const Calendar &, BusinessDayConvention bdc, const DayCounter &dc, const Period &lag, Frequency frequency, bool indexIsInterpolated, const std::vector< Date > &d, const std::vector< Volatility > &v, Rate minStrike, Rate maxStrike, const Interpolator1D &i=Interpolator1D())
memberdef.name: InterpolatedYoYOptionletVolatilityCurve

briefdescription.para: calculate the reference date based on the global evaluation date

detaileddescription.para: The dates are those of the volatility ... there is no lag on the dates but they are relative to a start date earlier than the reference date as always for inflation.

briefdescription.para: the minimum strike for which the term structure can return vols
the maximum strike for which the term structure can return vols
the latest date for which the curve can return values

detaileddescription.para: Interpolated in T direction and constant in K direction.
